content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here is a solution in Julia that should achieve the desired result:

```julia
using Markdown

function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    doc = MD.parse(md)
    
    # Filter out only code blocks with language julia
    julia_blocks = filter(b -> b.lang == :julia, doc.content)
    
    # Join all code blocks together with a newline
    joined_code = join(julia_blocks, "\n")
    
    return joined_code
end
```

This function parses the provided markdown string using the `Markdown.jl` library. It filters out only the code blocks that have the language attribute set to `:julia`. It then joins all the filtered code blocks with a newline character.

Keep in mind that you will need to have the `Markdown` package installed in your Julia environment. If it's not installed, you can add it to your environment using:

```julia
using Pkg
pkg"add Markdown"
```
